Instruction: Combine garlic powder, pepper, salt, paprika, bread crumbs, and flour in a shallow dish. Whisk together milk and egg in a separate dish.
Preheat a deep electric skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dip the chicken in the milk and egg mixture, then coat with the combined dry ingredients.
Fry chicken in the hot oil for approximately 5 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is fully cooked and the juices are clear. Use a slotted spatula to remove from the oil before serving.

The nutritional value of the oil for frying has been determined based on a retention value of 10% post-cooking. Amounts may vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and the type of oil used.
